title: Y3shot
author: Y3shot
content: A legendary US singer knonw as R Kelly has been jailed 30 year imprisonment for sex crime, this act has been his lifestyle for sometime in his music career.  The moral lesson from this story fame should not be taking for granted,  the slightest mistake can bring one low to square one in life, by then it will be too late for money and fame to come out and help.

comments.author: Foxpup
comments.body: I would hardly describe raping multiple underage girls as a "slight mistake".

comments.author: TheNineClub
comments.body: Quote from: Foxpup on June 30, 2022, 07:52:36 AMI would hardly describe raping multiple underage girls as a "slight mistake". OP maybe doesn't understand English that much, or he doesn't understand what rape is, and I really hope it's the first one, and that's it's a ''slight mistake'' on his side. As for Kelly, the only thing that shocked me is that it took so long for him to get sentenced, I remember stories circulating rather publicly a while back. I guess money can buy you extensions on trials, but it can't make anyone forget what he did. The moral of the story is not not to take fame for granted, but not to be a piece of shit human being, fame or not.

comments.body: I don't live in the USA and as I see that the news channels and newspapers lie a lot or sometimes exaggerate a lot so I don't know to what extent he can be guilty, but if the justice convicted him it's because they have evidence of the accusations they think about him, I listened to his music and it's shocking to know that the guy committed these atrocities, 30 years old for his age is the same as saying he's going to die in jail. I hope that the victims can overcome the trauma and that he can change in jail. Now talking about fame and money, well people think having those two things makes them god, I see it in the behavior of many rich singers and actors, they think they are god and untouchable, because they think their money buys everything

comments.author: Zlantann
comments.body: Quote from: Y3shot on June 30, 2022, 07:17:05 AMThe moral lesson from this story fame should not be taking for granted,  the slightest mistake can bring one low to square one in life, by then it will be too late for money and fame to come out and help.For me fame has nothing to do with his unruly behavior except that he used it to attract his victims and made them perform some shameful acts. There are countless celebrities that are well behaved, hence it was not fame that instilled that criminal behavior in him. If this crime was committed by someone else, that person would still get the same punishment or even more. The morale lesson for me is that we must learn to apply self control because our right stops where other people's right starts. Also we must learn to treat people the way we want to be treated. Would he be happy if someone did to his daughters what he was doing to his victims? R.Kelly have always been a cheat and derived pleasure in having lust dealings with underage girls. the case of Aaliyah is still fresh in my memory.

Like, how could someone be this evil. To take away someone's pride and made not to belong in the society.What was even more amusing was, even during his triers, he was still looking out for more teenage girls in the crowd of supporters to violate. He needs to be off the streets for a longer time. Where age won't be on his side to do any more damage when he eventually gets out, that's if he does get out.

I am grateful that this case has been rolled out and that R. Kelly has received a 30 year prison sentence for his crimes against sexual violence against women.
